question: Which nation's cultural and political campaign was "Illyrian Movement"?
explanation: Illyrian Movement was a pan-South-Slavist political and cultural campaign of Croatia. It was in real action during the first half of the 19th century. This movement aimed to achieve linguistic and ethnic unity through Croatian nationalism in Austria-Hungary, thereby cultural and linguistic unification under the term "Illyrian". This movement was actually a part of the Croatian national revival.
